Job.Title: Estimator (Building)
Job.Description: Highly reputable WA Building Company / SOR Location, Avoid Traffic, On site parking/Start on Contract, Permanent options if you excel/CIRCA $70/hr
Job.AdDetails:
• Superb WA Building Company
  • South of the River Location, Avoid Traffic!
  • CIRCA $70/hr, Permanent Role Available!

Our client is an established and successful West Australian civil and building construction contractor that has an IMMEDIATE need to recruit a contract Estimator to join their experienced team based in Perth’s southern suburbs. There is a strong possibility this role will go permanent in time. This business delivers construction projects typically valued up to $5m which may include; commercial and industrial buildings (public and private sector), apartments, mixed use developments and minor civil infrastructure (earthworks and concrete).

Working for this company is rewarding. You’ll join a professional team with great leadership who are vastly experienced in the delivery of construction projects in Western Australia. They have a superb 40 year track record of successfully delivering high quality, safe projects under their ISO9001:2008 Quality accreditation and AS/NZS4801:2001 Safety accreditation.

This Estimator role will involve preparing pricing for a variety of projects involving insitu structures, brickwork and tilt panels, that may be metro based or remote projects in Western Australia. This initial 4 week contract position will therefore appeal to an Estimator seeking diverse project exposure, and increased responsibility and ownership over winning new projects for the business. The prospect of this role moving to a permanent position is extremely high for a candidate who excels in this role.

It is essential that applicants have previously worked as an Estimator for building companies pricing projects valued up to $5m-$10m in Western Australia. Your role will involve reading plans and interpreting specifications to accurately perform detailed take offs and prepare cost plans for new projects. You will also issue tender packages to suppliers and subcontractors.

To be considered for this role ideally you will have:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Construction Management & Economics, Quantity Surveying or Engineering
  • Minimum 5 years’ experience as an Estimator for a commercial building company in WA
  • Proven ability to prepare “first principle” estimates on building/civil projects up to $10m
  • Previous success preparing successful tenders for public sector building developments.
  • Excellent computer literacy and ability to use Quest/Expert Estimation software or similar
  • A great attitude to work and a friendly disposition
  • Currently based in Perth with existing rights to live and work in Australia.

You will be offered a superb contract rate of CIRCA $70/hr as the successful candidate which will be tailored to your level of career experience to date. A permanent salary will be negotiated later if you excel in this contract role.

The company office is located in Perth’s southern suburbs so will suit a candidate based south of the river who wishes to avoid the daily grind of city traffic. This is an IMMEDIATE requirement so those able to start at short notice will be highly regarded.

To apply for this position please click on the APPLY link below. Alternatively, for a confidential appraisal of the current market please contact or email your resume quoting reference number SA28688.

Consultant: Scott Alexander

Phone: 08 9422 2702

Email: scott@stellarrecruitment.com.au

Job.Title: Front End Web Developer
Job.Description: Front End Web Developer - Brisbane Based - Join one of Australia's fastest growing Tech Companies
Job.AdDetails:
• Brisbane Based Position
  • Successful and Growing Tech-Start Up
  • Great Company Culture and Team

Our business Stellar Technology has close ties to the growing and exciting Tech-Start up scene in Brisbane, Australia. There is a real buzz in the city and a lot of investment from both government and corporate in this space. With an increasing shortage of Developers, pay rates increasing, excellent climate and relatively low cost of living compared to other cities, Brisbane offers a great option if you are looking to further your career.

Our client, an award winning and one of Australia’s fastest growing companies is currently looking for a Front End Web Developer to join there high performing team in central Brisbane. The business has a great company culture, is young and dynamic and has a great leadership team.

Key aspects of the role include:

  • Being involved in the technical direction of front end technologies
  • Work with JavaScript frameworks to create scalable applications
  • Testing to ensure stability and reliability of applications
  • Create usable and performance driven UI components
  • Designing tools, such as style guides to ensure other developers can work on the application

To be considered for the role you will need to have the following experience:

  • At least 3 years working with JavaScript
  • Experience with JavaScript frameworks and libraries e.g. ReactJS or Angular JS
  • Ideally have experience building responsive web applications
  • Knowledge of HTML5 and CSS3, including pre-processors such as Sass or LESS
  • Can create workflows using tools like NPM and Gulp

This is a great opportunity to get involved with a fast growing and innovate company who have global ambitions and are disrupting the market they are currently operating in.

In addition to the above role we are also looking for talented Front End and Back End WordPress developers and are generally interested in speaking to any IT professionals who might be interested in working in Australia.

To apply for this position please click on the APPLY link below or send me an email directly quoting reference number LE28673

Email: lucas@stellartechnology.com.au

Job.Title: Civil Foreman
Job.Description: $90k - $100k + Bonus / Full Private Use Vehicle / Award Winning Contractor / Career Progression into Management Positions / 55 Hours Monday - Friday
Job.AdDetails:
• $90k - $100k + Full Private Use Company Vehicle + Phone
• Leading Drainage & Civil Contractor
• Career Progression Into Management Positions

This company is an award winning civil contractor in Christchurch who specialise in drainage, sheet piling, de-watering, pump stations, pipe bursting, retaining walls, subdivision construction and large manhole installation projects.

Having recently won several high profile projects on top of their existing portfolio of work, they now require a hands on Drainage Foreman who can drive production on site and deliver projects successfully. In this role reporting to the General Manager, you will oversee a drainage crew of 4 - 5 staff and have full autonomy of the drainage team's day to day performance on site.

Some of your day to day tasks may include:

• Set-out of site, and co-ordination of crew
• Being hands on when required, lay pipe and operate machinery
• Revision of designs / plans, liaise with engineers and project managers
• Management of health and safety, on-site training, and quality control
• Key decision-making and on-the-fly coordination
• Communication with the Project Manager to ensure smooth day-to-day running of the operation

Ideally for this role you will have:

• Proven experience in horizontal civil construction
• Relevant drainage tickets (Registered / Certified Drainlayer)
• Exposure to a wide range of commercial drainage and broader civil projects

In return, you will be working for a reputable, long-standing contracting firm that is well established within the Canterbury region, with an attractive forward workload. Their emphasis upon developing their staff, means that they are looking for someone who is ready to commit to their organisation and further develop their skills.

This role would be an ideal stepping stone for someone who is looking to take the next step in their career into a Site Supervisor or Project Management level position.

To apply for this position please click on the 'Apply to this job' link below.

Alternatively, for a confidential appraisal of the current market, please contact Jordan Buchanan or email your CV quoting reference number JB19803.

Consultant: Jordan Buchanan
Phone: 03 353 5683 or 021 224 2814
Email: jordan@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

Job.Title: Project Manager - Next Step!
Job.Description: Embrace this exciting career step/Terrific Tier 2 Builder/Professional & Financial Rewards/Outstanding Leadership Team/Multiple Projects in Hand
Job.AdDetails:
• Retail/Commercial Developments $10-50m
  • Tier 2 National Builder, Exceptional Reputation
  • Tremendous Package, Outstanding Career Prospects

Our client is a highly successful Tier 2 building company that has a current requirement for a top class, Project Manager to join their Perth team for an upcoming project. This builder has nationwide presence, a young vibrant culture, and a terrific history of successfully completing a broad range of commercial building projects in the $10-50m range. Working within this business is inspiring as the management team is highly professional and promotes in internal culture of innovation and teamwork!

We are seeking a Project Manager on the rise and ready to take the next step in their career. You will have a proven track record of managing commercial building projects valued around $30m for similar sized commercial builders. Your previous experience must include complete Design & Construct retail and commercial building projects of this size from pre-contract stage through procurement, site establishment, construction, fit-out and handover. 

Our client is interviewing currently so you must be available immediately or on a maximum of one month’s notice, to be considered for this superb permanent vacancy. This will be a tremendous long term career opportunity for a Project Manager seeking employment with a highly reputable and successful Tier 2 builder. This business has achieved significant growth in WA in the last few years despite the extremely competitive nature of the current tender market, which is indicative of a great leadership team and uinique construction methodologies. 

You will need the following qualifications, skills and experience to be considered for this tremendous position:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Project Management, Construction Management & Economics, Engineering or similar
  • 5-10 years’ recent experience as a Project Manager delivering various types of commercial building projects in Australia
  • Previous Design & Construct commercial/retail building experience for building companies valued CIRCA $30m
  • Stable work history that includes reputable Tier 1&2 commercial building contractors
  • High level programming skills in MS Project and commercially astute to manage costs and meet budget targets
  • Great interpersonal skills to manage client interaction and ability to lead a team
  • Strong existing network of subbies and contacts in the Perth metro region
  • Currently based in Perth or WA with existing rights to live and work in Australia

A terrific remuneration package of CIRCA $160-180K will be offered to attract the industry’s best Project Manager. Join this terrific company and look forward to outstanding career opportunities as they continue their expansion in WA.

An opportunity has arisen for an experienced and energetic Industrial Electrician to work for one of New Zealand’s largest and most iconic FMCG groups. With business booming, we are looking for someone who shows commitment to the job and will go above and beyond to get things done.

You are able to work in a sole charge capacity, you have impeccable time management skills and you are committed to safety. You are required to have a firm understanding of electrical equipment, as well as proven experience in electrical maintenance in production environments. Grader operator


The Company

Job.Title: Excavator Operator 2IC
Job.Description: $23-$35 p/h / 50+ Hours / Temp & Perm / Auckland Wide
Job.AdDetails:
Excavator/Digger Operator

• Great Pay Rates!
• Great company
• Good gear

Stellar Recruitment is your number one choice for finding the best job opportunities in the civil construction market. We are specialists in civil infrastructure, construction and mining, and recruit for opportunities in NZ, Australia and even further abroad.

We are seeking a skilled, reliable Operator, who has experience operating excavators.

This role is not for the faint hearted, it is a physically demanding role that will give you the opportunity to further develop your career in the Civil construction industry. Not only will you be operating multiple machines but you will also be assisting on the ground as and when required.

Typically building Retaining Walls on large scale Civil works projects, our ideal candidate will have experience in the following:

• Drilling with Pendulum type drill rigs
• Excavating of footings
• Bulk Backfilling
• Compaction knowledge
• Machine Maintenance abilities

In order to be considered for this role you must have:

• Current Class 2 driver’s license
• Wheels Tracks and Rollers endorsed
• Excellent verbal communication skills
• Carry out regular maintenance of plant
• Team Player
• Reliable & punctual

What’s in it for you:

• Competitive rates of pay

We are looking for a forward thinking and experienced Maintenance Electrician with a ‘can do’ attitude to work for one of New Zealand’s largest and most iconic FMCG companies. With business booming, we are looking for someone who can roll up their sleeves and is ready to get their hands dirty. In this role you play a key role in the maintenance and repair of electrical equipment in a variety of manufacturing and processing environments. You will work in an efficient and timely manner, all the while demonstrating your commitment to safety.

This role will require you to have the ability to work as part of a team, as well as in a sole charge capacity and have impeccable time management skills.   • Familiarity with network protection systems

  • Strong fault finding skills with manual and automated gear (diagnostics and visual capability)

  • A background in the agricultural or dairy industry

  • A strong self-starter mentality with the ability to work in a team and a sole charge capacity

  • A flexible attitude towards to change and adjust well to unique environments

An attractive pay packet will be offered to the right person who shows commitment to the job, loyalty to the company and goes above and beyond to get the job done.

• Relocate to New Zealand via Stellar
  • Building Supervisors STEP UP in NZ!
  • Christchurch/Auckland/Queenstown, Start ASAP!

Stellar Recruitment has offices in Christchurch and Auckland in addition to Perth, and through our networks we are sourcing several Commercial Building Site Supervisors who are ready to step up to Site Manager level in the busy New Zealand building sector.

Now is a perfect time to consider moving to New Zealand where there is significant demand for your skills as a commercial building Site Manager. Stellar Recruitment has strong existing relationships with many of the busiest building companies involved in the Christchurch rebuild program, and other significant building projects being undertaken in picturesque locations such as Auckland and Queenstown.

We have multiple roles available for experienced Site Supervisors looking to take the next step in their career and take ownership of running their own building sites as a Site Manager. Ideally you will have a trade background and stable 5-10 years’ experience in Australia or NZ as a Construction/Site Supervisor for reputable Tier 2 or Tier 3 commercial building contractors. You will have exposure planning, coordinating and supervising construction activities on projects $5-50m within commercial, mixed use, education, health, aged care and retail sectors. In addition, you will possess a strong worth ethic, great leadership qualities and excellent communication skills. It is a prerequisite that you have existing rights to live and work in New Zealand and a willingness to relocate there within the next few months.

In New Zealand as Site Manager, you can expect CIRCA $90K-120K depending on location and role specifics. New Zealand is the adventure capital of the world with a fabulous lifestyle and lower cost of living, genuine career opportunities, and long term job security. The time is right to hop across the Tasman and get involved in the busy NZ Building sector!

Job.Title: Civil Engineer - Transportation
Job.Description: • To carry out 3D designs in appropriate software packages for roading andurban development projects
Job.AdDetails:
Daylight savings is here and I suppose “Winter is coming”. AS we adjust to the time change the mornings are sunny and fresh and the working day is an exciting concept, but how long will this last? With the days increasingly getting shorter and your only spare time being the weekend don’t let the change of the seasons become any worse by not being happy at work.

We spend at least 40 hours a week at work, let alone thinking about work in our down time and with the ever increasing digital world the temptation to check our emails on the weekend is constant.


In 2016 life balance and culture are rated as the number one for job seekers, if you’re in any doubt that you’re not working in the right culture you’re lucky, change is no longer a taboo word, and the right opportunity could only be a phone call away.


Stellar have partnered with a top tier consultancy whose values and culture very much match our own. With some great senior acquisitions already, opportunities are available for the right person who wants to join an established company who prides themselves on a family winning culture.


The role:
With the ever increasing demand for work in Wellingtons Transport centre, Stellar are looking to speak with Civil Engineers in the Roading and urban development fields. You will be carrying out *3D designs using *Civil3d, *12d and *Autocad for roading and urban development projects such as geometry and basic pavement design), stormwater and wastewater (catchment flows, pipe sizing, treatment devices) etc. As well as possessing the right technical skill, this role will be client facing, so strong business development skills is essential as you will be attending meetings and building and maintaining relationships etc. Within this role career development is key, and this company is always pushing, and assisting in elevating your career. One final note this role will require travelling to other sites on occasions, so a driver’s licence is required.

What you will need
• Civil Engineering Degree
• 5 years post grad experience
• Storm and wastewater experience
• Proficient in Civil 3D Autocad, and 12D
• Client Facing skills
• New Zealand Experience
• Driver’s license


What we offer you
• Career development
• Established projects
• International consultancy
• Family culture
• Growth
• Senior established team


So if your morning optimism only lasts until your first coffee, perhaps you fell undervalued, or would just to like to hear what’s next, and you match the above criteria, please feel free to drop me a message to adam.t@stellarrecruitment.co.nz or call 099691029, and let’s have a confidential chat about where you want your career to go.


Thank you.
Kind regards,
Adam Towler
Engineering & Design Specialist
P +64 9 969 1029
E adam.t@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

Job.AdDetails:
Daylight savings is here and I suppose “Winter is coming”. AS we adjust to the time change the mornings are sunny and fresh and the working day is an exciting concept, but how long will this last? With the days increasingly getting shorter and your only spare time being the weekend don’t let the change of the seasons become any worse by not being happy at work.

We spend at least 40 hours a week at work, let alone thinking about work in our down time and with the ever increasing digital world the temptation to check our emails on the weekend is constant.


In 2016 life balance and culture are rated as the number one for job seekers, if you’re in any doubt that you’re not working in the right culture you’re lucky, change is no longer a taboo word, and the right opportunity could only be a phone call away.


Stellar have partnered with a top tier consultancy whose values and culture very much match our own. With some great senior acquisitions already, opportunities are available for the right person who wants to join an established company who prides themselves on a family winning culture.


The role:
With the ever increasing demand for work in Wellingtons Transport centre, Stellar are looking to speak with Civil Engineers in the Roading and urban development fields. You will be carrying out *3D designs using *Civil3d, *12d and *Autocad for roading and urban development projects such as geometry and basic pavement design), stormwater and wastewater (catchment flows, pipe sizing, treatment devices) etc. As well as possessing the right technical skill, this role will be client facing, so strong business development skills is essential as you will be attending meetings and building and maintaining relationships etc. Within this role career development is key, and this company is always pushing, and assisting in elevating your career. One final note this role will require travelling to other sites on occasions, so a driver’s licence is required.

What you will need
• Civil Engineering Degree
• 5 years post grad experience
• Storm and wastewater experience
• Proficient in Civil 3D Autocad, and 12D
• Client Facing skills
• New Zealand Experience
• Driver’s license


What we offer you
• Career development
• Established projects
• International consultancy
• Family culture
• Growth
• Senior established team


So if your morning optimism only lasts until your first coffee, perhaps you fell undervalued, or would just to like to hear what’s next, and you match the above criteria, please feel free to drop me a message to adam.t@stellarrecruitment.co.nz or call 099691029, and let’s have a confidential chat about where you want your career to go.


Thank you.
Kind regards,
Adam Towler
Engineering & Design Specialist
P +64 9 969 1029
E adam.t@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

Job.Title: Graduate Commercial Project Manager Cadetship
Job.Description: We are currently looking for smart, engaging, and motivated Building Construction Management, or similar, graduates that are career focused, dedicated
Job.AdDetails:
• Once in a life time opportunity
• Work alongside mentors on commercial projects
• Long term employment

This is your opportunity to work for an Australasian wide extremely successful large commercial builder/construction management company that has an impressive portfolio of works in Christchurch. You will be involved in a three year long program.

This is a very rare opportunity to work your way to the top, to a position as a Commercial Project Manager running significant architecturally designed multimillion dollar projects. Once in this role, following the completion of your cadetship, you will be working with Engineering Consultancies, Designers, Earthworks, Sub Trades, and in-house experts to ensure timely delivery of projects.

This is a “from the ground up" Cadet Program, where your responsibilities will include:
- Initial placement in the office shadowing staff
- Performing administrative duties such as data entry into the construction programme
- Updating client and project details
- All remedial and ad hock tasks as required
- Completing training modules

To be successful in your application you need:
- To have competed, or started, a construction based diploma, degree or
  certificate
- To be based in Christchurch, or be based in New Zealand able to     
  relocate at your own expense quickly
- Present in a corporate professional fashion
- Have strong articulate verbal and written communication skills
- Be able to commit to 5 years work, at least
- Have a career goal of becoming a Project Manager in the local construction sector

If you are a driven, motivated new entrant into the employment market, that is hard working and wants to prove themselves in this profession, then we want to hear from you. This position will be snapped up quickly and will be filled as soon as the right application is secured, so don’t delay in getting in your application in.

Job.Title: Maintenance Electrician
Job.Description: Are you an experienced industrial electrician who is ready for a challange and enjoys being part of a great team? Than we want to hear from you!
Job.AdDetails:
We are looking for a forward thinking and experienced Maintenance Electrician with a ‘can do’ attitude to work for one of New Zealand’s largest and most iconic FMCG companies. With business booming, we are looking for someone who can roll up their sleeves and is ready to get their hands dirty. In this role you play a key role in the maintenance and repair of electrical equipment in a variety of manufacturing and processing environments. You will work in an efficient and timely manner, all the while demonstrating your commitment to safety.

This role will require you to have the ability to work as part of a team, as well as in a sole charge capacity and have impeccable time management skills. You must have a firm understanding of electrical equipment and practices, and you will have the desire to continuously develop yourself while working in an ever changing and fast paced environment.

To be successful in this role you will have:

  • Current NZ Electrical Registration

  • Experience in electrical maintenance in fixed plant environments

  • Knowledge ofSCADA, VSD and PLC

  • Familiarity with network protection systems

  • Strong fault finding skills with manual and automated gear (diagnostics and visual capability)

  • A background in the agricultural or dairy industry

  • A strong self-starter mentality with the ability to work in a team and a sole charge capacity

  • A flexible attitude towards to change and adjust well to unique environments

An attractive pay packet will be offered to the right person who shows commitment to the job, loyalty to the company and goes above and beyond to get the job done.

To apply, or if you would like to know more, please contact our specialist maintenance trade and electrical recruiter today.

Charlotte Heystek

Job.Title: Intermediate Quantity Surveyor
Job.Description: Join this Professional Quantity Surveying Consultancy and secure your opportunity for career development on rewarding projects.
Job.AdDetails:
• Genuine Career Progression
• Renowned Company in Commercial and Government Projects
• Rewarding Remuneration Package + Bonus

About the Company:

Our client is an expert Professional Quantity Surveying (PQS) Consultancy with a strong local brand, specialising in project solutions from concept to completion. Emphasis is placed on challenging the norm, where promotion of an entrepreneurial culture is valued and rewarded accordingly. This successful organisation leads by example and are unwavering in their push to challenge the status quo. Due to increased steady growth over the last year, this very successful PQS Company is seeking a strong Intermediate Quantity Surveyor of 2 years + experience, who is looking for an opportunity to develop in a fun and dynamic environment.

About the Role:

Within your role as an Intermediate Quantity Surveyor, you will collaborate closely with a Senior Manager on the initial stages of contract acquisition. Your reporting lines are direct to the Senior Manager, although this role is autonomous in the sense of full ownership over projects. You will have the opportunity to be involved in some of their largest projects across the business.

Responsibilities:

• Drive the successful delivery of medium to large commercial projects
• Manage and build strong, long-term relationships with partners and customers
• Support a number of key projects at once

Culture:

Our client has developed a strong internal culture of team work, collaboration and a sense of ‘family’ among their valued employees. In their words, the solution is simple “our industry is about people, only great people make great teams”. They believe the best results are achieved not only by what you do, but by doing them better than everyone else. The organisation fosters an environment of high performers and high achievers that are handpicked and share the same understanding of success, high performance and enjoyment.

The ideal candidate should have:

• Minimum 2 years’ experience as a Quantity Surveyor
• New Zealand experience
• A degree or diploma in Quantity Surveying
• Demonstrated business partnering abilities
• Display a genuine interest in career development and team leadership

How to Apply:

If you are looking for long term career prospects, an excellent remuneration package and the opportunity to be an integral team member for the acquisition and involvement of some of New Zealand’s most exciting and challenging projects, please contact Alisha for a confidential discussion.

Job.Title: Interface Manager (Perth)
Job.Description: Terrific Major Project role with a Tier 1 Civil Contractor / Lock in some Job Security in Perth! / Road/Rail/Tunnel D&C exp. reqd /CIRCA $160-170K
Job.AdDetails:
• Tier 1 Civil Construction Contractor
  • Major D&C Project, Site Based Role (Perth)
  • Long Term Job Security & Terrific Salary Package

Our client is a civil industry powerhouse. They are an industry-leading Tier 1 civil contractor with national presence and a superb track record delivering major design and construct projects across the entire civil infrastructure sector. They have a looming requirement for an Interface Manager to join their professional management team in Perth, to be based on site during the design and construction phases of a major civil infrastructure project.

This will be a terrific opportunity for a candidate seeking long term job security in Perth where currently there is a lot of instability and uncertainty. If you have Tier 1 civil design and construction experience on major public infrastructure projects (ie. Roads/rail/tunnels/TBMs) as a Interface Manager, you don’t have to move east to find your next role!

As Interface Manager you will perform the critical role of expediting the flow of information between all design disciplines and various project stakeholders to maintain progress and coordinate with site activities to meet project deliverables. You will track progress and the status of engineering interfaces across the project, develop improvements to interface issues, and report to senior management on potential delays to the project schedule. The role will be 40% design interface management and 60% construction.

To be considered for this terrific role as Interface Manager you must fulfill the following criteria:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Civil/Structural/Construction Engineering
  • 5-10 years recent experience as a Interface Manager (or similar) on major public civil infrastructure projects including roads/rail/tunnels/TBMs in Australia
  • An even mix of experience coordinating design and construction teams for design/engineeirng consultancies and Tier 1 construction contractors on roads/rail/tunnel projects for clients such as MRWA/PTA/MRA
  • Great interpersonal skills to effectively and positively manage client and internal stakeholder interactions across disciplines and resolve issues amicably as they arise
  • Existing rights to live and work in Australia

As the successful Interface Manager you will be rewarded with a terrific salary package that will be tailored to your specific level of skills and experience, and long term job security within a large successful company.

*All applications will be treated as confidential and EVERY applicant will receive a response from Stellar.

To apply for this position please click on the APPLY link below. Alternatively, for a confidential discussion please contact Scott Alexander on 08 9422 2702 quoting reference number SA28853.

If you have experience as a Design Coordinator on major public infrastructure projects (rail/metro systems/roads preferred), this could be a terrific opportunity for you!

As Design Coordinator you will be a critical conduit for the management and flow of the correct design information to project stakeholders in a timely fashion during the design and construction stages. This will include but will not be limited to; managing a team of designers to meet project targets, managing the design-change process and updating design registers, providing design input during the construction phase, liaising with various design consultants and team members to align budget, procurement and supply chain timelines, and create internal design reports.

To be considered for this exciting new role as Design Coordinator you will need to meet the following criteria:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Engineering, Construction or Design
  • 6+ years post graduate experience in Design Coordinator or similar Engineering roles undertaking tasks outlined above on major public infrastructure projects in Australia
  • Recent experience as a Design Coordinator for Tier 1 construction contractors or engineering companies on rail/metro system/road projects (*Previous experience on Perth PTA/MRWA projects will be highly regarded)
  • Great interpersonal skills to effectively manage internal and external stakeholder interactions across all disciplines
  • Strong work ethic, adaptable and the ability to work to tight deadlines in a fast paced environment.
  • Perth based with existing rights to live and work in Australia

As the successful Design Coordinator, you will be rewarded with a terrific salary package (CIRCA $130-135K + super) that will be tailored to your specific level of skills and experience, and long term job security within a large successful construction company.

*All applications will be treated as confidential and EVERY applicant will receive a response from Stellar.

To apply for this position please click on the APPLY link below. Alternatively, for a confidential discussion please contact Scott Alexander quoting reference number SA28855.

Job.Title: Maintenance Electrician
Job.Description: If you enjoy working in an ever-changing and fast-paced environment, then this could be your next role!
Job.AdDetails:
We are looking for an experienced and energetic Industrial Electrician to work for one of New Zealand’s largest and most iconic FMCG groups. With business booming, we are looking for someone who shows commitment to the job and will go above and beyond to get things done.

You are able to work in a sole charge capacity, you have impeccable time management skills and you are committed to safety. You are required to have a firm understanding of electrical equipment, as well as proven experience in electrical maintenance in production environments. You are a strong self-starter, open to change and adjust well to new environments. You want to continue to develop yourself professionally and you will have:

  • A current EWRB Registration

  • Solid working knowledge of SCADA, VSD and PLC

  • Familiarity with network protection systems

  • Strong fault finding skills with manual and automated gear (diagnostics and visual capability)

  • A background in the agricultural or dairy industry

  • Are open to change and adjust well to unique environments

This role will have you working as part of a maintenance team, playing a key part in the maintenance and repair of electrical equipment in a variety of manufacturing and processing environments. This group invests in its people and an attractive pay packet will be offered for the right person.

To apply, or if you would like to know more, please contact our specialist maintenance trade and electrical recruiter today.

Job.Title: Construction Inspector
Job.Description: Long term contract working in bridge replacements and culvert works in Regional QLD
Job.AdDetails:
CONSTRUCTION INSPECTOR

  • Long term contract position
  • Growing Consultancy
  • Muliple opportunities

About the Client

This client is a growing Australian consultancy with a very strong client base within the transport sector.

About the role

We are working on their behalf to find 4 Construction Inspectors, preferably with a background including exposure to rail engineering and/or bridge/culvert projects. The position will monitor contractor performance from a QA and WHS perspective. This roles are initailly for 6 months. The positions are regional and will based around the following locations: Cairns, Townsville, Bundaberg and Toowomba. These roles are not FIFO, so the successful candidates must either be located in the regions or be willing to relocate at own expense.

Duties

Reporting to the Design and Contracts Manager, the main responsibilities of the Construction Inspector include, but are not limited to the following:

• Review Contractors WHS management plan and assess performance against this
• Review and monitor Contractors Environmental plan
• Monitor Contractors progress against construction plan
• Perform inspections of civil engineering contracts
• Maintain site surveillance and arrange audit inspections

Skills and Experience

• 5 years plus experience of Construction Inspection on Rail and/or building projects
• Ideally Trade Qualification
• Preferably experience in the rail industry or in bridge/culvert works
• Ability to work both as part of a team and independently; self-motivated and able to act on own initiative
• Ideally hold RII40712 Cert IV in Civil Construction Supervision and must have White Card
• Must have access to 4X4 for site visits

What's On Offer

This is an excellent opportunity to join a highly respected engineering consultancy, who work on exciting and diverse projects across Australia. They have a great company culture and defined paths for your career advancement.

Click APPLY or contact Andy Steel for a confidential discussion.

• Genuine once in a lifetime career opportunity
• Successful design and construction contractor
• Learn and develop from industry leading experts

About the company:

Our client is an established and successful design and construction contractor. They operate in all sectors with specialist expertise in commercial, retail, infrastructure and government buildings. After a long and successful portfolio in Australia, in this organisation has set up in New Zealand and is taking the market by storm over the last few years with offices in Christchurch and Auckland.

About the role:

In this role you will collaborate closely with a senior organisational member, working across organisational divisions to constructively develop your expertise as a project manager. This role is very much long-term focused, where you will progress to a position as a Commercial Project Manager running architecturally designed multi-million dollar projects. This is a structured development programme with a genuine career progression focus. Following completion of your cadetship, you will collaborate with Engineering Consultancies, Designers, Earthworks, Sub Trades and internal industry experts to ensure timely delivery of projects.

Responsibilities:

• Shadowing/observing staff
• Conduct administrative duties such as data entry in the construction programme
• All remedial and ad hock tasks as requested
• Completing training modules as required
• Updating client and project duties

The ideal candidate should have/be:

• Completed or started a construction based tertiary qualification
• Based in Christchurch or easily able to relocate at short notice
• Possess strong communication skills (both verbal and written)
• Display a genuine interest in committing to this outstanding organisation
• Long-term career focused to develop as a Project Manager

Culture:

Construction professionals choose to align their career with this organisation because of their people focused culture, developed and led by their experienced executive team who have worked together over several years. The project and division leaders have progressed through their strong internal training systems, much like the opportunity available in this role.

Job.Title: Maintenance Planner - Fixed Plant
Job.Description: Are you a well versed Mechanical Fitter/Engineer with strong software package exposure? Ready to come off the tools?
Job.AdDetails:
• Are you a Mechanical Engineer/ Fitter looking to get off the tools with solid planning skills?
• Do you want a chance to work for a stable and long standing company in the NZ market with room to grow and progress your career?
• Want to work in genuine environment that will provide variety & supportive management?

A promising role has arisen for a proven Maintenance Planner to work for one of the leaders in the processing industry here in Otago. In this roles you will play a key part in the on-going maintenance planning of heavy plant equipment including mechanical and fabrication work and life cycle servicing/refurbishment of components, strip downs and refits across mechanical and electrical facets of the plant. You will work for a company that values their staff and encourages progression from within its small but dedicated team while encouraging you to think outside the box. You will have the opportunity to continue to develop your strong background, solid technical skills and experience and will be rewarded with progression opportunities, sole charge responsibilities and a competitive salary package (with a warm office to boot).

To be successful in this role you will have:
• Proven experience Mechanical Engineering (on fixed plant facets) with trade certification and exposure across planning packages.
• Experience working in either a workshop or onsite team as well as independently.
• Excellent diagnostic skills visually and fault finding capabilities (this will help you be the expert in the planning team)
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
• A strong ability to be a self-starter and get the job done.
• A fantastic attitude and a good amount of job pride.

To apply, or if you’d like to know more, such as location info, pay rates, work conditions and facilities, the gear you could be working on, or for info on the opportunities that we have throughout New Zealand, contact our specialist maintenance recruiter today.

Due to an internal promotion, a promising opportunity has arisen for a Service Manager to work for a top New Zealand heavy transport company, operating a leading truck repairs operation. Due to strong continued growth, a promising opportunity has arisen for a Truck Crane Mechanic to work for a top equipment/trucking company, based in Canterbury, New Zealand. In this role you will play a key part in the on-going maintenance, repair and organisation of a team working on a wide range of heavy material handling and crane equipment both in the workshop and out in the field. Working with a fleet that utilises some of the most modern machinery and diagnostic systems available in the market, industry safety standards that are second to none and a wealth of knowledge in their leadership teams, you will have the opportunity to continue to develop your technical skills and experience, meanwhile being rewarded with progression opportunities and a growing pay-packet. • $90k - $100k + Full Private Use Company Vehicle + Phone
• Leading Drainage & Civil Contractor
• Career Progression Into Management Positions

This company is an award winning civil contractor in Christchurch who specialise in drainage, sheet piling, de-watering, pump stations, pipe bursting, retaining walls, subdivision construction and large manhole installation projects.

Having recently won several high profile projects on top of their existing portfolio of work, they now require a hands on Drainage Foreman who can drive production on site and deliver projects successfully. In this role reporting to the General Manager, you will oversee a drainage crew of 4 - 5 staff and have full autonomy of the drainage team's day to day performance on site.

Some of your day to day tasks may include:

• Set-out of site, and co-ordination of crew
• Being hands on when required, lay pipe and operate machinery
• Revision of designs / plans, liaise with engineers and project managers
• Management of health and safety, on-site training, and quality control
• Key decision-making and on-the-fly coordination
• Communication with the Project Manager to ensure smooth day-to-day running of the operation

Ideally for this role you will have:

• Proven experience in horizontal civil construction
• Relevant drainage tickets (Registered / Certified Drainlayer)
• Exposure to a wide range of commercial drainage and broader civil projects

In return, you will be working for a reputable, long-standing contracting firm that is well established within the Canterbury region, with an attractive forward workload. Their emphasis upon developing their staff, means that they are looking for someone who is ready to commit to their organisation and further develop their skills.

This role would be an ideal stepping stone for someone who is looking to take the next step in their career into a Site Supervisor or Project Management level position.

To apply for this position please click on the 'Apply to this job' link below.

Alternatively, for a confidential appraisal of the current market, please contact Jordan Buchanan or email your CV quoting reference number JB19803.

Consultant: Jordan Buchanan
Phone: 03 353 5683 or 021 224 2814
Email: jordan@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

Job.Title: Project Manager
Job.Description: Christchurch based Opportunity for Experienced Project Manager to lead an Exciting Project with an Established World Leading Company
Job.AdDetails:
Project Manager – Civil Infrastructure Projects, Christchurch

 

  • Global Construction, Operations and Maintenance Company

  • Challenging High Profile Civil Infrastructure Project

  • Above Market Rate Salary + vehicle + laptop + phone

Do you want to work for a civil construction organisation, operating globally in the resources, energy, industrial, civil infrastructure, rail, property and defence sectors. They now require an experienced Civil Construction Project Manager with strengths in stakeholder management including dealing with the council, local business and underground services / utility owners. As the project involves working on public thoroughfares and within community neighbourhoods, it is high profile and very much in public view.


Ideally for this Project Manager role you will have;

  • Tertiary Qualifications in Civil Engineering

  • 10 -15 years experience in civil construction

  • 8 years in a Project Management position ideally experienced in drainage, water reticulation and general installation of underground services.

  • Excellent communication, leadership and stakeholder management skills

  • Ability to problem solve and provide solutions

  • Experience managing multiple operations at different locations

  • A history of successfully delivering project upwards of $20M

  • Knowledge of HSE risks and changing traffic management challenges

 

In return for your skills you will be rewarded with a competitive remuneration package which will include a vehicle, laptop and mobile phone.  If you are keen to take advantage of this opportunity and meet the required criteria above, please click on the APPLY link below.

Alternatively if you want a confidential discussion on this role as well as an appraisal of the current market please contact me on the number below quoting JJ28612.

Consultant: Jason Jones
Phone: 03 974 2443
Email: jason.j@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

Job.Title: Site Supervisor
Job.Description: Opportunity due to increase forward work for a Site Supervisor across drainage, earthworks, roading & farm works jobs.
Job.AdDetails:
Civil Site Supervisor – Ashburton

  • Local Well Established Contracting Company

  • Wide Variety of Civil Infrastructure & Earthworks Project

  • Excellent Opportunity for Career Progression + vehicle

Come and work for an award winning Mid-Canterbury Civil Contractor, operating in the greater Canterbury region, Timaru District and South Canterbury. Due to an increasing forward workload a new position has been created for a Site Supervisor to lead and manage multiple small crews at different sites to ensure quality and progress are in line with expectations. Reporting to the Operations Manager or general Manager you will look after the crews in charge of various smaller job including maintenance jobs for Council, drainage, earthworks, roading and farm works.


To be successful in this role, you should have:

  • Minimum 3 - 5 years experience in civil construction

  • Minimum 2 - 3 years in a Supervisor Role

  • Experience in managing crews with multiple disciplines as well as overseeing sub-contractor

  • Experience with scheduling resources.

  • Basic IT skills – use of spread-sheets, email etc

  • A strong OH&S track record and strong general safety awareness

  • The ability to drive performance and meet targets

  • Experience setting levels and a confident operator

In return you will be part of an established and respected, growing contractor who are supportive and friendly. Salary package will suit experience + company vehicle for full use.  


To apply for this position please click on the APPLY link below.


Alternatively if you want a confidential discussion on this as well as an appraisal of the current market please contact me on the number below quoting reference JJ28963.

Consultant: Jason Jones
Phone: 03 974 2443
Email: jason.j@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

Job.Title: Geotechnical Engineer
Job.Description: Christchurch Based - Work for a company with an innovative approach to land development & great career potential!
Job.AdDetails:
• Innovative, Successful Company

  • Industry Leading Professionals All Around You

  • Above Market Rate Salary & Great Career Progression

Do you want to work at a leading surveying, engineering and planning consultancy

based in Christchurch. Our company has been locally owned and operated since its establishment over 80 years ago and enjoys an excellent reputation for its high level of expertise. Our staff enjoy cutting edge technology and excellent on-the-job training and mentoring. If you want to be part of a multi-disciplinary consultancy with all the teams working closely together then keep reading.
To be successful in this role, you should have:

  • 5-6 years’ experience in civil engineering, specialising in geotechnical engineering

  • 3 years local experience in the post-earthquake environment in Canterbury

  • Can work well both in a team and on your own

  • Formal Planning and Reporting capabilities

  • Basic IT skills – use of spread-sheets, email etc. on tablets or laptops

  • Working towards CPEng or recently chatered.

  • Excellent communication skills, dealing with both staff & clients in a professional manner

In return you will be part of an innovative and high performing team who strive to be at the top of their field.  Our staff come from a range of different cultures and enjoy a dynamic, harmonious, family-friendly work environment. We operate a flexible work practice with a flat, collegial structure with direct

access to all levels in our organisation.  


To apply for this position please click on the APPLY link below.


Alternatively if you want a confidential discussion on this role as well as an appraisal of the current market please contact me on the number below quoting reference JJ28959.

This company is an award winning civil contractor in Christchurch who specialise in drainage, sheet piling, de-watering, pump stations, pipe bursting, retaining walls, subdivision construction and large manhole installation projects.

Having recently won several high profile projects on top of their existing portfolio of work, they now require a hands on Drainage Foreman who can drive production on site and deliver projects successfully. • Key decision-making and on-the-fly coordination

Ideally for this role you will have:

• Proven experience in horizontal civil construction
• Relevant drainage tickets (Registered / Certified Drainlayer)

Graduate Engineering Surveyor / Survey Technician

  • Wide Variety of Civil Infrastructure & Earthworks, and Roading Projects

  • Excellent Opportunity for Career Progression

  • Working as both a Lead Contractor and Sub-contractor & a Quarrying Operation

 

Are you a talented, accurate Graduate Engineering Surveyor / Survey Technician with 1 - 5 years’ experience? Do you want to assist in the set up and delivery of a range of projects form subdivisions to major roading infrastructure project in and around Christchurch? Working for a leading contractor, you will play a key role in survey set out, asbuilt pick-up, processing survey data for both monthly claims and to be loaded on to our machines, earthworks survey and machine calibration. With over 40 years of proven track record you will join an existing business with an established and supportive working environment which is based on quality and performance.

To be successful you should possess the following attributes:

  • Good knowledge of 12D and CivilCAD products

  • Civil construction experience essential

  • Previous experience on major roading and earthworks projects preferred

  • Ability to work autonomously if required

  • Graduate Surveyor / Technician with 1 - 5 year surveying (engineering) experience

  • Good knowledge of Trimble or Leica gear

  • Understanding of NZS 3910 contracts an advantage

  • Confident processing data and calibrating equipment

     

     

    In return you will be part of an established and respected contractor with a huge forward workload including some of the biggest projects in the area. Salary package will suit experience. Most importantly we are looking for someone who is passionate about surveying and delivering results opposed to lining their pockets. We have a great team culture where everybody digs in and want to ensure the successful applicant is the right fit.

Job.Title: Engineering Interface Manager
Job.Description: IMMED START! / Terrific National Tier 1 Construction Contractor / Major Project / Manage & Coordinate Exchange of Project Information / CIRCA $170K
Job.AdDetails:
• Major Civil Infrastructure Project (Perth)
  • Coordinate & Manage Project Information Flow
  • CIRCA $170K, IMMED Start!

About the Company:

Our client is a highly regarded Tier 1 multi-disciplinary contractor currently undertaking a major civil infrastructure project in Perth. Their business is synonymous with the planning and construction of some of Australia’s largest civil infrastructure projects nationwide including roads & major freeways, railway systems, tunnels and dams.  

About the Role:

As Engineering Interface Manager on this interesting and unique project, you will be responsible for implementation and maintenance of the interface management process throughout the project lifecycle. You will establish a framework for communication and exchange of information between engineering disciplines and project participants in a timely and efficient manner. The ultimate aim of the Engineering Interface Manager will be to remove or minimize risks associated with ongoing design development and project changes that may impact cost and schedule.

Duties:

  • Identification of internal and external interface relationships
  • Establish interface processes to manage flow of information between design and construction teams
  • Coordinate and monitor status of project interfaces via meetings
  • Facilitate & resolve issues pertaining to information exchange between parties
  • Track and document exchange of information between participants to monitor performance

Skills & Experience:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Engineering or Construction Management
  • 5-10 years’ post graduate experience in Australia managing engineering interface relationships on $200m+ civil infrastructure projects including; roads/rail/tunnels/airports
  • Experience on these projects under Design & Construct contracts working for construction contractors or engineering companies
  • Excellent all-round understanding of interactions associated with design and construction of multi-disciplinary major projects
  • Superb communication skills with ability to influence, coordinate and resolve issues
  • Perth based with existing rights to live and work in Australia

Company Culture:

Working within this highly professional company is rewarding. Employees enjoy the benfit of a highly experienced management team, a terrific team environment, and outstanding opportunities to work on major projects in Australia.

Benefits:

  • Perth based project location, no FIFO!
  • Enhance your career on a major project with a civil contracting leader
  • CIRCA $170K (*dependent on experience)

Job.Description: Work for a main contractor in a senior position with an impressive portfolio of work and developed systems in place
Job.AdDetails:
Full time role based in Christchurch
Major commercial main contractor
Work closely with Directors/decision makers

This position is with a sophisticated Main Contractor and Construction Management company that is making its mark on the Christchurch commercial construction market. With multiple large scale commercial buildings already completed, and new projects won, you will be able to put your name toward some of Christchurch’s major developments, leading the project alongside a Senior Project Manager.

With projects valued predominantly in the $15 million to $30 million range we are looking for applicants with substantial Commercial Quantity Surveying experience that are driven and hold real excitement for the rebuild. There is potential to lead a small team of Quantity Surveyors on projects, or work in a sole charge model to suit you.

This company has a fast paced, hardworking, and energetic atmosphere where successes are celebrated. Although they are a formidable force in the market, this is a medium sized company in terms of staff numbers, so you will not be lost in the crowd, you will be able to have influence, and you will be able to speak daily with Directors if needed.

Your responsibilities will include:
- Liaison with clients, design consultants, engineers, and council
- Managing the subcontractor tendering process
- Supplier and material negotiations
- Estimation
- Pricing and scheduling of all quantities
- Variations
- Progress payments
- Final account


Successful applicants will need:
- A relevant Qualification
- 5 years, or more, commercial build based experience
- Have worked as a Quantity Surveyor on projects upwards of $12 million
- Preferably have some New Zealand based experience
- Professional presentation and communication
- A down to earth team player attitude

There is an immediate need for this positon, so this role will be filled as soon as a suitable candidate is secured. This position is based in Christchurch and is a long term full time position. Salary is dependent on the individual’s experience, but is paying up to $130,000. You will need to already be based in Christchurch, or relocate easily at your own expense.

If you would like to know more about this positon and company before you apply please contact Brooke Farmer, Senior Consultant in the Commercial Construction space, on 03 974 2442 or 027 635 3330. I am most readily available Tuesdays and Thursdays. All conversations and applications are treated as private and confidential until you have agreed to have your details released.

Look forward to viewing your application soon.

Job.Title: Parts Interpreters
Job.SearchTitle: Parts Interpreters - Central NSW - Ag Sector
Job.Description: Experienced Parts Interpreters required for a growing Ag Dealerships based in Central NSW. Permanent positions on offer with this market leader
Job.AdDetails:
• Have you got strong organisational skills with a personality to match?
  • Parts knowledge from working with a range of Ag Equipment or Earthmoving Dealerships?
  • Want to work for a progressive company who will help you achieve your career goals?

Due to strong continued growth, an opportunity has arisen for a Parts Interpreters to work for a progressive Australian based Agriculture dealership with branches nationwide. In this role you will play a key part in the procurement, stock monitoring and counter sales of a wide range of heavy Ag machinery parts, based in a predominant workshop. You will be working with an experienced team of mechanics, sales reps and managers who get the variety in their workload most companies only dream of. This company has industry safety standards and systems that are second to none and you will have the opportunity to continue to develop your skill and knowledge base as well as experience within the market. You will be rewarded with a very competitive remuneration package and the opportunity to progress your career to the next step, assisted by a management team who have all started out on the floor.

You’ll need to have the following:

  • 3-5 years’ experience working in either Agriculture or Earthmoving dealerships
  • A mechanical aptitude
  • Current Forklift License
  • Experience in a customer service environment.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Be a strong self-starter with excellent time management and organisational skills

Perhaps you’re looking for the chance to learn from the best or advance your career by aligning with a strong procurement team within the Agriculture industry, either way this position is an ideal vehicle for achieving your personal and professional goals. As an employer, this company has a strong market profile and stability, providing excellent longer term growth potential.

To apply, or if you’d like to know more, such as location info, pay rates, or for info on other opportunities that we have throughout Australia please hit apply and one of our team will be in touch.

Mark Powell
Email: mark@stellarworkforce.com.au

StandOut.Bullet3: Great Culture with OEM training provided

Job.Title: Leading Hand Carpenter
Job.Description: leading hand required for commercial project, large project with plenty of room to progress to site manager, above market rates, call Gabbie 09 969102
Job.AdDetails:
Carpenter

• Key position on site- Leading a team
• Busy main contractor with many key projects
• Attractive hourly rates and progression to foreman/ site manager available

About the Company:

Stellar Recruitment are currently partnered with a market leading construction company, one of the biggest in New Zealand, who is looking for an experienced and motivated carpenter to assist with some of their biggest projects. This main contractor is currently working on some intricate and exciting projects on the North Shore of Auckland and due to the large amount of work, are looking for a qualified carpenter who can get stuck in and get the job done.

About the Role:

You will be working on a large commercial and residential site where you will be involved in all aspects of the building process. You will be required to lead a group of carpenters and work autonomously on site as well as ensuring everything runs smoothly and to plan. Health and safety will be a big focus for you and you will uphold this to the highest standard, as well as making sure all carpenters adhere to safe work practices at all times.

Duties:

• All aspects of carpentry on site as required
• Leading a group of carpenters on site
• Upholding health and safety requirements to the highest standard
• Complete all work with accuracy and to tight time restrictions
• Interpret plans and blue prints

Skills & Experience:

• Trade Qualified carpenter(Certificate 4 in carpentry as a minimum)
• Working at heights trained ( Unit standard 23229 or 15757)
• Ramset license
• Hilti license
• Dogman Certificate
• EWP trained
• At least 2 years’ experience

Culture:

Our client provides a supportive and safe work environment for all employees. They take pride in their team and provide training and progression opportunities to all employees. Although a large team they are personable and inclusive, the site managers know all their guys by name and enjoy a good laugh throughout the day.

Benefits:

• Progression opportunities
• Supportive friendly work environment
• Completive hourly rates


How to Apply:

Phone Number: (09) 9691026
Email: gabrielle.f@stellarworkforce.co.nz

Job.Title: QA/Contracts Engineer - Civil
Job.SearchTitle: QA/Contracts Engineer | Busy Civil Contractor | Auckland City
Job.Description: Highly Successful Civil Contractor | Permanent opportunity, becoming a key team member | Auckland City
Job.AdDetails:
• Responsible for construction contracts, QA,  H&S and assisting with site management
  • Well-established and successful civil contractor based in Auckland City
  • Remuneration guideline of $65,000

About the Company

Our client is one of the best known civil contractors in the Auckland Region. They provide a range of services to the civil construction industry and have carved out a solid reputation for a number of specialist construction methods, winning repeat business year on year.

About the Role

As the QA/Contracts Engineer you will need to have a background in Civil Construction. You will be responsible for a variety of functions, which will include assisting the project managers with site documentation, H&S, working on tenders and contract administration. You will be the link between the site teams and the office. There will be requirement for site visits, photographing assignments and reporting. This role would best suit a Civil Engineer with experience on site and wanting to move into the office.

Duties:

  • Site auditsand incident investigation

  • Pre start documentation

  • Monitor and record variations

  • Complete QA info for client

  • Complete monthly claims

  • Assist with producing Quotes

  • Order materials, plant and equipment

  • Organise subcontractors and tip sites

Skills & Experience:

  • Tertiary qualification in Civil Engineering (diploma, degree)

  • 10+ years’ experience in construction industry

  • Understanding of site engineering, tender preparation and QA work.

  • Solid communication skills and ability to relate to all levels within a business

Culture:

This business has a culture of developing and upskilling their employees, with heavy involvement from directors all the way down to site level. They provide autonomy at every opportunity, while also training and mentoring to allow careers continue in the right direction. It is a relaxed, informal office feel, far from the corporate world of a Tier One contractor. If you enjoy a good laugh at work and being involved in a successful team then this is the role.

Benefits:

  • Decent base rate

  • Negotiable hours of work (to a degree!)

  • Involvement at the leadership table

  • Exposure to a broad variety of business functions

Click APPLY or contact Maurice Deevy for a confidential discussion.

Phone Number: 099691022

Email: maurice@stellarrecruitment.co.nz

Job.Title: Contracts Administrator
Job.Description: Contracts Administrator
Job.AdDetails:
Our client is a Ipswich based building company that has an immediate requirement for a Qualified Contract Administrator to join their Ipswich office on a contract basis until mid January 2017. This builder specalises in industrial and agricultural projects.

This Contract Administrator position is a permanent requirement based in the Ipswich head office. In this role you will provide direct support to various design & construct commercial building projects primarily in the Ipswich and Western Brisbane region. You will become an essential and valued team member in the delivery of high quality building projects which will ultimately help this business achieve their overall business objectives.

As Contract Administrator within this business you will work within a team environment and focus on both pre-award and post-award contract administration tasks. You will be a “self-sufficient” Contract Administrator you will be responsible for commercial and cost management methods with a great attention to detail. Within your role you will manage subcontractor packages and payments, variations and progress claims, prepare financial cost forecasts, monitor cash flow, budgeting, and prepare progress reports.

Ideally you will have the following qualifications and background as the successful applicant:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Construction Management would be an advantage, although not essential,
  • Highly competent using cost management programs
  • minimum 2 years' experience within the Building/ Construction sector would be highly regarded
  • Able to quickly grasp concepts and apply innovative options
  • Great written and verbal communication skills

If you are a motivated individual seeking exciting, long term career prospects within a great building company, register your interest today!

Job.Title: HR Manager (ASAP Start!)
Job.Description: IMMED Start, Osborne Park / Parking provided / 38 hr week / Manage a team / Coordinate Multi-Site Mobilization & Employment Contracts / CIRCA $75/hr
Job.AdDetails:
• 3 Week High-Paced Contract
  • New Project Awarded, Lead a Team
  • Osborne Park, IMMEDIATE START!!

About the Company:

Our client is a highly regarded national civil contractor that has recently won a new mine site construction project. Their business has a terrific reputation for delivering high quality concrete and earthworks projects on schedule and under budget. 

About the Role:

As HR Manager employed on contract basis for the next 3 weeks minimum, you will be responsible for leading and coordinating a team of three Senior HR Advisors during the preparation of employment documentation and mobilization of around 150 site staff asap.

Duties:

  • Interpreting the site plan, EBA and Fair Work legislation, and drafting up letters of offer to new employees
  • Drafting employment contracts
  • Liasing with mining clients
  • Coordinating a team of 3 HR Advisors to manage mobilization to several construction sites
  • Handling any disciplinary action required on sites and preparing/recording applicable documentation
  • Some “hands-on” tasks to support your HR team where needed

Skills & Experience:

  • Tertiary qualifications in Human Resources Management
  • 5+ years’ post graduate experience in Australia managing small HR teams mobilizing large work forces to resource sector construction projects
  • Previous experience drafting up employment letters in line with site specific EBA’s and Fair Work legislation
  • Experience with and knowledge of ERMS systems preferred
  • Excellent all-round communication skills
  • Currently Perth based with existing rights to live and work in Australia

Company Culture:

Working within this highly professional company is rewarding. Employees enjoy the benefits of a highly experienced management team, a terrific team environment and outstanding opportunities to work on major projects in Australia.

Benefits:

  • Osborne Park based office in Perth, no FIFO!
  • Parking provided
  • Enhance your career with a civil contracting icon
  • CIRCA $75/hr (*dependent on experience)

You will be responsible the planned and reactive maintenance, servicing and diagnostics of many heavy transport units, working within a rapidly expanding workshop with a team of like-minded technicians. Representing some of the most respected brands within New Zealand and internationally, safety standards second to none and an ever expanding workload, there is no better time to look at making the move.

Job.Title: Intermediate - Senior Quantity Surveyor
Job.Description: Join this sucessful commercial construction company and secure your opportunity for career development on rewarding projects.
Job.AdDetails:
• Rewarding Commercial projects
• New Zealand owned and operated
• People focused culture

About the company:

The opportunity presented is working with an organisation the commercial construction market. With steady growth in the commercial build effort in the Canterbury region, this fast paced commercial contractor is seeking to appoint a Quantity Surveyor to complement their current team.

About the role:

Concentrating on the commercial construction build, the appointee’s role will encompass all aspects of a Quantity Surveyors portfolio, such as preparing tender and contract documentation, cost analysis, allocating work to sub-contractors and producing progress reports.

We are seeking a proven Quantity Surveyor with a background in commercial construction. Concrete experience is an advantage. You will ideally have a contractor side focus with extensive New Zealand experience, supported by a sound understanding of local codes and legislation. You will ideally be adaptable, professional and motivated with experience working with projects with a value between 1-30 million.

Responsibilities:

• Detailed pricing and scheduling of quantities
• Participation in estimation/leading tenders
• Evaluation, selection and negotiation of sub-contract tenders
• Liaison with design consultants and construction sub-contractors
• Contract administration, cost-management, variations, payment claims

Culture:

Construction professionals choose to align their career with this organisation because of their people focused culture, developed and led by their experienced executive team who have worked together over several years. You will be working for a well-known and long established organisation, with a firm focus on maintaining its family feel, high level of job responsibility, and positive enjoyable environment.

How to apply:

Please contact Alisha if you have any questions or wish to have a confidential conversation about this position. Otherwise you can express your interest by applying today. Your application will be treated in the strictest of confidence.
